title: Limiting parallel
summary: In neutral or absolute geometry, and in hyperbolic geometry, there may be many lines parallel to a given line l {\displaystyle l} through a point P {\displaystyle P} not on line R {\displaystyle R} ; however, in the plane, two parallels may be closer to l {\displaystyle l} than all others (one in each direction of R {\displaystyle R} ).
